website_summaries.verdict: Wasteland 2 is genuine fun, packed with enough lore to make you want to keep exploring and adventuring, well past your bedtime.
pros: Wasteland 2 is a sprawling epic of an RPG with solid combat and exploration,  and storyline that keeps you driving forward
cons: It can be fiddly in terms of its interface and there's still a few bugs here and there

customer_reviews.title: An excellent and fun game
customer_reviews.text: An excellent and fun game, but confusing as it installs the original and Director's Cut edition. I accidentally completed the original with no way to import my characters in to the DC version, negating the replay value for me. I tried several hacks for this with one success, but the game was then corrupted halfway through (I half-expected this) so gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Burrick

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this game so much because I am a huge ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this game so much because I am a huge fan of the developers and the original fallout series. While the game wasnt bad it lacked the ability to draw me into it like the old rpg games. Overall a solid game but it was just missing something. Navigating the 3D terrain was often very confusing as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cody S.

customer_reviews.title: Not everyones cup of tea
customer_reviews.text: Far to many keys to remember and way to much dialogue
customer_reviews.author: silver

customer_reviews.title: Horribly addictive! Haven't been this wrapped up by a ...
customer_reviews.text: Horribly addictive ! Haven't been this wrapped up by a computer game in years....Having owned and operated a computer/software store, I've played many games....This is one of the best!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karta

customer_reviews.title: must join steam to play
customer_reviews.text: I bought the disc because I wanted a stand alone game. I didn't want to be part of the steam community. The game is fine when the internet is working.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R Smith

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT A GAME DISC!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a disc for Wasteland 2. It only has the Steam client on it. You still have to download the whole 9.3 GB game from Steam. I'm not disappointed in the game but I feel that the product is misrepresented here. What is the point of the disc if you still have to download everything.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: This game is cool. I have never played the orignal
customer_reviews.text: This game is cool. I have never played the orignal. It is exactly what I wanted from a turn based game. Post apocalyptic vibe is fun. Amazon purchase and shipping are always easy and timely.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Stanfield

customer_reviews.title: Review of the packaging. Not the game.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for a simple manual and game disc. Don't bother, just buy a downloadable version of the game somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: M. sheirel

customer_reviews.title: Meh game
customer_reviews.text: This game has graphics from the early 2000's, and mediocre gameplay. I would give this game a 4/10. The developers raised 3 million dollars for the creation of this game and I'm not really sure where that money went cause it sure didn't go to this game. This game is worth $10 max. Stay away until the price goes down.
customer_reviews.author: Austin S.

customer_reviews.title: Misrepresented purchase
customer_reviews.text: I can't review the game yet, but this product itself is completely misrepresented. I purchased the disk, rather than the online code, because I have an extreme data-limit on my internet package at home. Come to find out the disk doesn't have the game on it, but you have to then download 21G to even play it. I'm allotted 20G a month, so now I'm stuck driving my PC to someone else's house and sitting around for a few hours to enjoy something that should be plug and play. If you're selling a disk version, shouldn't the entire game be included?
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Rafferty

customer_reviews.title: DRM-free version @ GoG.com
customer_reviews.text: I'm slightly biased as I backed this game on Kickstarter. Wasteland 2 is a very good party-based RPG with quite a bit of replayability. Think Icewind Dale meets Fallout Tactics. If you want the Steam / DRM free version, you need to skip this version & go buy it @ GoG.com.
customer_reviews.author: J. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Game is ok but not thrilling
customer_reviews.text: Playable AFTER second patch. The game has its moments but is mostly a salute to the original Wasteland. Lots of inside jokes and asides related to original Wasteland. This game is NOT anything like FALLOUT which is far superior. There does not seem to be a good justification to re-create this style of play with the availability of Fallout/Skyrim engines. I did like the rapidity of "leveling up"; especially with multiple team members.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Chappell

customer_reviews.title: I loved the game
customer_reviews.text: I loved the game, it really brought me back to the flavor of the original Wasteland. There were some initial bugs that have been ironed out through several patches. You can get a version that runs through Steam, or buy a DRM free version from GOG.com. Writing this to counterbalance the one star reviews that aren't actually reviewing the game (which I happily supported through kickstarter)
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: ... give a full review yet but so far it's great. Will update later
customer_reviews.text: Haven't played enough to give a full review yet but so far it's great. Will update later.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bornell

customer_reviews.title: better yet, skip this game (and it's corporate reach ...
customer_reviews.text: Was given this a gift. Was given the physical copy as internet is currently spotty where we are. Game forced me to go through an online service (Steam), and download the actual game through them. The DVD is not the game. It is just a shortcut to download the game. Save your time, and order it elsewhere online. You get nothing but extra wait time with this purchase. Or, better yet, skip this game (and it's corporate reach arounds) altogether. I'll not play, and the DVD has been thrown away.
customer_reviews.author: Erin McCann

customer_reviews.title: I feel like a rube
customer_reviews.text: Well this was a big lie. They told everyone during the kickstarter that the game would be DRM free, then send you the game with a Steam key. I feel like a rube...
customer_reviews.author: Meteor Bear

customer_reviews.title: Fallout parody with lack of details
customer_reviews.text: Fallout style game with a limited design. There are a pretty much items, but level design is lack of details. Very slow engine and ugly gameplay. This home-made game should be for $5 and no more.
customer_reviews.author: baram

product_meta.title: Wasteland 2 - PC
product_meta.description: Welcome back to the Citadel, Rangers! Join the over 70,000 Kickstarter backers and interact with the development team to help shape the ending of an already historic post-apocalyptic story. The Wasteland's hellish landscape has been waiting for you to make your mark. or die trying. Wasteland 2 is the direct sequel to 1988's Wasteland, the first-ever post-apocalyptic computer RPG and the inspiration behind the Fallout series. Until Wasteland, no other CRPG had ever allowed players to control and command individual party members for tactical purposes or given them the chance to make moral choices that would directly affect the world around them. Wasteland was a pioneer in multi-path problem solving, dripping in choice and consequence and eschewing the typical one-key-per-lock puzzle solving methods of its peers, in favor of putting the power into players' hands to advance based on their own particular play style. The Wasteland series impressive and innovative lineage has been preserved at its very core, but modernized for the fans of today with Wasteland 2. Immerse yourself in turn-based tactical combat that will test the very limits of your strategy skills as you fight to survive a desolate world where brute strength alone isn't enough to save you. Deck out your Ranger squad with the most devastating weaponry this side of the fallout zone and get ready for maximum destruction with the RPG-style character advancement and customization that made the first Wasteland so brutal. Save an ally from certain death or let them perish - the choice is yours, but so are the consequences.Wasteland 2 requires internet connection and download from Steam in order to play. Please be aware that contents of this product may differ from editions provided to Kickstarter backers.
feature_bullets: One Size Does Not Fit All: Don't feel like finding the key for a door? Why not try a Rocket Launcher! Basically the same thing... right?
Enhanced Classic RPG Game Play: Classic RPG game play ideas updated with modern design philosophies
Decision Making... with Consequences: With both short and long term reactivity to the players choices, every decision matters in the outcome of the story
Huge & Customizable: dozens of hours of game, hundreds of characters, thousands of variations on your Rangers' appearance, over 150 weapons, dozens of skills, even the UI can be customized

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars52 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
